intro: Pariana concinna, commonly known as the narrowleaf pariana, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Pariana concinna is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its historical use in traditional medicine.
